title: Geneva named ‘Europe's Leading City Break Destination’ at World Travel Awards 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Geneva named ‘Europe’s Leading City Break Destination’ at World Travel Awards 2015 Published on : Tuesday, September 8, 2015
Consolidating its status as an ideal destination for a weekend break, Geneva for the second consecutive year has been named “Europe’s Leading City Break Destination” at the World Travel Awards 2015. The award ceremony, often touted as tourism’s Oscar, took place at Forte Village in Sardinia on 5 September 2015.
Geneva’s touristic assets and appeal, high quality services in terms of accommodation and experiences to visitors as a destination helped it beat stiff competition from cities such as Paris, London, Rome, Istanbul, Madrid, Lisbon, Venice and Dublin, as well as new nominees Porto and Lodz.
Philippe Vignon, Director of Geneva Tourism, after the receiving the award said, “”Geneva is a lively destination, full of surprises, which is worth exploring during a business trip as well as over a weekend,” Geneva now becomes part of the new trend of “city break” trips, i.e. short weekend breaks.
Vincent Dubi, Marketing Director of Geneva Tourism said, “This prize endorses our strategy of developing touristic products with high added value, such as the creation of various packages aimed especially at short-stay visitors.”
